description.narrative: In 2017, the country will have systems for monitoring the situation of children, and for the evaluation of childhood and adolescence policies and services that incorporate the rights approach under international CRC and CEDAW standards, ensuring that public services provide development opportunities for children and adolescents., which contributes to Access To Justice, Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Cross-Sectoral Early Childhood Development, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Early Childhood Development, Early Learning, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning Outcomes, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, children and adolescents enjoy higher levels of social inclusion, have better development opportunities, gain access to quality services and have their opinions heard, thereby helping to reduce the gap between the poorest 20% of the population and the wealthiest 20%.

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

title.narrative: UNICEF Programmes in Chile (Crisis and Emergencies)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: In 2017, the country will have systems for monitoring the situation of children, and for the evaluation of childhood andadolescence policies and services that incorporate the rights approach under international CRC and CEDAW standards, ensuring thatpublic services provide development opportunities for children and adolescents.

description.narrative: Evidence-based advocacy and policy dialogue by UNICEF Chile had a meaningful impact on legislative, institutional and programmatic developments towards the country&39;s compliance with its international obligations and standards as regards child rights and wellbeing. | Status:Met | As-of Date:28/12/2017

title.narrative: Family courts have a protocol to guarantee the right of children and adolescents to be heard in legal processes directly affecting them.

target.value: 2016:60% of family court judges trained in the procedures for interviewing children and adolescents.

title.narrative: Childhood indicators system relevant and accessible, with harmonized and quality data.

actual.value: 2016:Indicator system operating in two areas: Education and Health and being developed to complete other areas.
